findings.title: AOI - Arithmetic Operations Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract uses both SafeMath library and native arithmetic operations, which can introduce inconsistencies and undermine safety measures.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: MC - Missing Check
findings.description: The contract does not verify if a user is a participant in the specified pool or has staked any tokens before allowing them to call the `leavePool` function with an amount of zero, potentially leading to misleading events and confusion.

findings.title: ΑDU - Αrbitrary Decimals Usage
findings.description: The contract calculates the rewards assuming the tokens decimals are fixed, but the token property is mutable and can be changed by the contract owner to have different amounts of decimals, leading to precision errors.

findings.title: SRAI - Sufficient Reward Amount Issue
findings.description: The contract is distributing rewards without checking if the contract's balance is sufficient to cover the reward amount.

findings.title: CTI - Claim Time Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract does not enforce the claimTimeLimit when users call the joinPool function, allowing users to potentially claim their rewards before the claimTimeLimit by rejoining.

findings.title: PTAI - Potential Transfer Amount Inconsistency
findings.description: The `transfer()` and `transferFrom()` functions may produce inconsistency between the expected and actual behavior due to ERC20 transfer tax.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments which can lead to issues like gas efficiency, complexity, readability, security, and maintainability of the source code.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions 0.8.0 and above provide native functionality for arithmetic operations.

findings.title: RSK - Redundant Storage Keyword
findings.description: The contract uses the `storage` keyword in a view function which is redundant as view functions do not modify the state of the contract and do not perform any actions that cost gas.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that are initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards. Declaring these variables as immutable can save gas by allowing the Solidity compiler to make certain optimizations.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity style guide naming conventions, affecting readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L11 - Unnecessary Boolean equality
findings.description: Boolean equality is unnecessary when comparing two boolean values.
